SEARCH
Module com.kentwentyfour.project12
Package com.kentwentyfour.project12.mathpackage

Class FormulaCalculator

java.lang.Object
com.kentwentyfour.project12.mathpackage.FormulaCalculator
public class FormulaCalculator extends Object
This class is for calculating formulas given as a string.

RULES FOR INPUT:

  • Between every element, there must be a space: good -> [1 + 3 ( 2 ^ -4 ) * 3], bad -> [1+ 3( 2^-4 ) *3]
  • No support for more than one sign [+ - 2....] or [- - 2 ...]. good -> [ - ( 4 - 7 ) ], bad -> [- ( - ( 3 + 3 ) +3 ....)]
  • If a number is negative, there must be no space: good -> [ -1 ], bad -> [ - 1 ]
  • You can use '.' and ',' for decimals, e.g., [ 2,3 + 3 - 1.1 * 2,4]
  • Square root supported: sqrt( 4 )

How to use:

  1. Create a List<String> that will store the parsed formula.
  2. Parse the input string and save it to the List<String>: parseString(String).
  3. Add initial conditions/solutions: setIndependentValue("X", 1).
  4. Calculate, returns double: calculateRPN(List<String>).

  • Method Details

    • parseString

      public List<String> parseString(String equation_string)
      Parses a mathematical expression into a list of tokens. This method takes a mathematical expression string and converts it into a list of tokens using the Shunting Yard algorithm. The tokens represent the expression in Reverse Polish Notation (RPN), making it easier to evaluate. Supported Operations:
      • Addition (+)
      • Subtraction (-)
      • Multiplication (*)
      • Division (/)
      • Exponentiation (^)
      • Square Root (sqrt(...))
      • Natural Logarithm (ln(...))
      • Sine (sin(...))
      • Cosine (cos(...))
      • Tangent (tan(...))
      • Cotangent (cot(...))

      Parameters:
      equation_string - The input mathematical expression to be parsed
      Returns:
      A list of tokens representing the parsed expression in RPN
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is null or empty

    • setIndependendValue

      public void setIndependendValue(String name, double value)
      Sets the value of an independent (dynamic) variable.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the independent variable
      value - The value to be assigned to the variable

    • addPartialDerivative

      public void addPartialDerivative(PartialDerivative pd)

    • calculateRPN

      public double calculateRPN(List<String> list)
      Calculates the result of a mathematical expression in Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) using stacks.

      This method evaluates the given mathematical expression, which is provided in RPN format, using a stack-based algorithm. It supports basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /), exponentiation (^), and square root (sqrt). The method also handles dynamic variables by looking them up in the provided dictionary of independent values.

      Parameters:
      list - The list of tokens representing the mathematical expression in RPN
      Returns:
      The result of the evaluation

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
